Gene therapy CDMO (Patheon) = manufacturing for longevity treatments. Precision medicine tools, bioprocessing, clinical trials support. Longevity angle: enabling entire ecosystem of longevity R&D and manufacturing. Trading 28x with consistent growth and margin expansion. Diversified revenue (pharma 50%, academic 25%, industrial 25%) = stability.

ISRG enables longevity via robotic surgery - minimally invasive procedures = faster recovery, fewer complications, extended healthspan for elderly patients. Da Vinci robot monopoly (80%+ market share), razor/blade model (procedures drive recurring revenue). Longevity angle: surgery on 70-80 year-olds becomes viable with robotics, enabling extended healthspan. Aging population needs more procedures. Trading 58x for quality/growth - premium justified by moat. Procedures growing 15%+ annually.

Applications: cancer early detection (Grail), pharmacogenomics, aging biomarkers, longevity research. Market leader (80%+ share) with moat from installed base and technology. Trading 35x (down from 80x peak) after Grail divestiture. Longevity requires understanding individual genetics - Illumina enables this. Diagnostic companies (GRAIL, Tempus, Guardant) all use ILMN platforms.

Cash cow CF business ($10B revenue) funds gene therapy R&D. Trading 27x for innovation pipeline. Gene therapy is ultimate longevity play - fixing root cause vs treating symptoms.
Longevity & Healthspan Innovators custom BUY NVO 182.55 $54.78
NVO is THE longevity play via GLP-1 drugs (Ozempic, Wegovy). Obesity reduces lifespan ~8 years; weight loss extends healthspan significantly. GLP-1s showing cardiovascular benefits, diabetes prevention, potential Alzheimer's/kidney benefits. Multi-decade runway from obesity epidemic (40%+ of developed world overweight/obese). Dominant market position (65% share), manufacturing moat, pipeline depth (oral GLP-1, next-gen weekly). This is proven longevity intervention at scale. Trading 32x for 20%+ growth with durable franchise. Core holding for longevity thesis.

Market treating as permanently impaired; reality is temporary constraint with massive upside when removed. Buying when everyone 'knows' WFC is radioactive. Asymmetric: minimal downside from tangible book support, 40%+ upside from re-rating when cap lifted.

This insider alignment counters concerns about valuation and reinforces the narrative of sustained demand for their government and commercial platforms.

Insider Following Strategy Gemini BUY PLTR 25.25 $178.15
A cluster of recent open-market purchases by the CTO and two directors totaling over $1.8 million in July-August 2025 signals insider conviction despite a premium valuation. The buying occurred following a healthy 15% pullback, indicating that leadership views the current price as attractive relative to the company's long-term growth trajectory in the AI and data analytics space. This insider alignment counters concerns about valuation and reinforces the narrative of sustained demand for their government and commercial platforms.

These open-market buys occurred after a 30% stock price decline, suggesting executives see the current valuation as a compelling entry point ahead of key clinical data readouts for their lead drug candidate. Christopher Browne Strategy Gemini BUY INTC 270.20 $37.01
Intel is a classic value investment, priced for failure despite its substantial assets, IP portfolio, and strategic importance. The market has overreacted to recent competitive setbacks and the high cost of its foundry transition. As Intel executes its turnaround and benefits from government incentives, its earnings power should recover, leading to a significant re-rating of the stock.
Christopher Browne Strategy Gemini BUY C 123.62 $97.07
Citigroup is trading at a significant discount to its tangible book value as the market focuses on short-term restructuring costs and macroeconomic headwinds. The company's simplification strategy should unlock substantial value over the long term as profitability improves. This provides a compelling margin of safety for a global systemically important bank.
Charlie Munger Strategy Gemini BUY JPM 20.16 $297.56
JPMorgan Chase stands as a best-in-class global financial institution with leading positions across consumer, commercial, and investment banking. Its 'fortress balance sheet,' superior management, and economies of scale allow it to consistently generate high returns on tangible common equity (ROTCE) through economic cycles. At its current valuation, the stock offers a fair price for a durable franchise with diversified revenue streams and a commitment to returning capital to shareholders.
Charlie Munger Strategy Gemini BUY MCO 12.74 $471.04
Moody's holds a dominant position in the credit rating industry, an oligopoly with significant barriers to entry and strong pricing power driven by regulation and reputation. The business requires little capital to grow and generates exceptional returns on equity and free cash flow. Its expansion into the high-growth analytics segment provides diversification and further strengthens its long-term compounding potential.
Charlie Munger Strategy Gemini BUY V 20.47 $341.89
Visa operates a dominant global payments network, a classic 'toll road' business with immense scalability and a powerful network effect that forms a nearly insurmountable competitive moat. The company benefits from the secular shift to digital payments, exhibiting high margins, strong free cash flow generation, and minimal capital requirements. Its consistent growth and pricing power make it a quintessential wonderful business.
Charlie Munger Strategy Gemini BUY BRK-B 16.25 $492.42
Berkshire Hathaway represents the pinnacle of the 'wonderful business' philosophy, acting as a diversified holding company of high-quality, cash-generative operating businesses and investments. Led by a proven capital allocation framework, it offers a defensive yet compounding investment with exposure to premier insurance, railroad, and utility assets. The current price relative to book value and future earnings power presents a fair entry point for a core, long-term holding.

Its current valuation fails to appreciate a robust product pipeline, strong cash flow, and the earnings power of recent acquisitions. This presents an opportunity to acquire a high-quality, defensive business at a low multiple with a secure dividend yield.

The valuation remains disconnected from its current profitability path, making it highly vulnerable to any miss in bookings guidance. We believe the market is underestimating the impact of competition for user attention and a macro environment that pressures in-game spending.

Customer spending optimization is becoming a significant headwind, pressuring the company's consumption-based model. We anticipate the upcoming earnings call will reveal weaker-than-expected product revenue and forward guidance, acting as a catalyst for a valuation reset.

The ongoing, albeit slow, restructuring presents a clear opportunity for an activist to accelerate value realization. Pressure on management to expedite the sale of non-core international businesses and increase capital returns could force the market to re-evaluate the stock closer to its tangible worth.

An activist investor could pressure the board to separate the chip design and manufacturing units, unlocking a sum-of-the-parts valuation significantly higher than the current stock price.

The path to realizing value involves pressuring the board for a strategic breakup or significant operational restructuring to improve its chronically low ROE.

This ignores a robust product pipeline, the successful integration of recent acquisitions, and a very attractive dividend yield, creating a compelling value opportunity in a defensive sector.

The market is assigning little value to the eventual recovery in the flash business, offering an attractive risk/reward profile.

It acts as a diversifier against equity risk while being less sensitive to interest rate changes than long-duration bonds, anchoring the portfolio across moderate growth environments.

Its negative correlation with equities during stress periods provides a powerful diversification benefit, stabilizing the overall portfolio during market downturns.

This component is essential for portfolio performance during periods of rising growth and stable inflation, balancing other assets designed to hedge against downturns.

This aligns directly with the goal of supporting healthier, longer lives through less invasive interventions.

Its expansion beyond intensive insulin users to the broader Type 2 diabetes and pre-diabetes populations creates a massive addressable market. The recurring revenue from sensor subscriptions and a sticky data ecosystem provide a durable competitive advantage in extending healthspan.

Expanding indications into cardiovascular risk reduction and sleep apnea solidify its role as a core healthspan asset with a vast, recurring revenue model. The robust pipeline in immunology and oncology provides further long-term upside.

Moody's possesses an unbreachable moat in the credit ratings duopoly, granting it significant pricing power and highly predictable, recurring revenue. As capital markets normalize in 2025, a recovery in debt issuance will fuel growth. We believe the market underappreciates the durability of this capital-light, high-margin business model, presenting an opportunity to own a premier franchise at a fair price.

The stock is priced for continued market share loss, ignoring the long-term potential of its IDM 2.0 strategy and foundry ambitions. While current profitability is weak, the low price-to-book ratio provides a margin of safety based on its vast manufacturing assets.

Strong free cash flow generation even at lower commodity prices provides downside support and funds shareholder returns.

Citigroup continues to trade at a significant discount to its tangible book value, suggesting the market values its collection of businesses at less than their liquidation worth. An activist campaign could force management to divest underperforming international units and streamline its consumer and institutional businesses, unlocking substantial value. The path to realizing value involves pressuring the board for a strategic breakup or significant operational restructuring to improve its chronically low ROE.

Insider Following Strategy Gemini BUY PLTR 25.26 $178.12
A cluster of recent open-market purchases by the CTO and two directors totaling over $1.8 million in July-August 2025 signals insider conviction despite a premium valuation. The buying occurred following a healthy 15% pullback, indicating that leadership views the current price as attractive relative to the company's long-term growth trajectory in the AI and data analytics space. This insider alignment counters concerns about valuation and reinforces the narrative of sustained demand for their government and commercial platforms.
Insider Following Strategy Gemini BUY ONC 18.87 $318.02
A significant cluster of insider purchases, led by a $1.5 million buy from CEO Yang Liu in August 2025, provides a powerful bullish signal. These open-market buys occurred after a 30% stock price decline, suggesting executives see the current valuation as a compelling entry point ahead of key clinical data readouts for their lead drug candidate. This high-conviction buying in a capital-intensive biotech firm indicates strong belief in the upcoming trial results and long-term platform value.

Deutsche Bank's significant exposure to the sluggish Eurozone economy presents a major headwind, with risks of a turn in the credit cycle. Despite restructuring efforts, it continues to lag the profitability and returns of its better-capitalized US peers. We view the stock as vulnerable to a repricing should European macro conditions deteriorate further.

Robinhood's business model is overly reliant on volatile transactional revenue from retail trading, particularly in options and cryptocurrency, which we expect to decline in a risk-off environment. The company faces significant regulatory headwinds regarding Payment for Order Flow (PFOF) and a difficult path to sustained profitability amid intense competition from established brokers.

Its largely subscription-based, high-margin business model ensures predictable, recurring revenue streams. The increasing complexity of global markets and demand for sophisticated data analytics provide a long-term secular tailwind.

The market is pricing in a pessimistic scenario of continued market share loss, while undervaluing its strategic importance and the tangible value of its fabs. This provides a 'cigar-butt' opportunity with potential upside from a partial turnaround or stabilization.

Citigroup is trading at a substantial discount to its tangible book value, presenting a classic deep value opportunity. The market appears to be overly pessimistic regarding its ongoing restructuring and regulatory environment. The current price offers a significant margin of safety based on the company's vast asset base.
Activist Value Investing Gemini BUY PFE 283.06 $24.73
The market is overly penalizing Pfizer for declining COVID-related revenue, ignoring its core business and pipeline potential. The stock trades at a significant discount to its intrinsic value with a strong balance sheet, offering a compelling opportunity. An activist could push for a strategic review to divest slower-growth assets and focus resources on high-potential therapeutic areas, accelerating value recognition.
Activist Value Investing Gemini BUY C 72.84 $96.10
Citigroup continues to trade at a deep discount to its tangible book value, reflecting years of operational missteps and lower returns than peers. An activist is needed to enforce cost discipline and improve capital allocation following the simplification of the bank's structure. A clear path to achieving peer-level return on tangible common equity (ROTCE) would lead to a significant re-rating of the stock.

An activist can push for a more aggressive roadmap, asset sales, or a separation of its design and foundry businesses to unlock shareholder value. The current valuation provides a substantial margin of safety against further execution risks.

Exxon Mobil is undervalued relative to its vast asset base following a cyclical downturn in energy prices. Strong free cash flow generation even at lower commodity prices provides downside support and funds shareholder returns.

An activist campaign could force management to divest underperforming international units and streamline its consumer and institutional businesses, unlocking substantial value. The path to realizing value involves pressuring the board for a strategic breakup or significant operational restructuring to improve its chronically low ROE.

Charlie Munger Strategy Gemini BUY V 20.39 $343.30
Visa operates a dominant global payments network, a classic 'toll road' business with immense scalability and a powerful network effect that forms a nearly insurmountable competitive moat. The company benefits from the secular shift to digital payments, exhibiting high margins, strong free cash flow generation, and minimal capital requirements. Its consistent growth and pricing power make it a quintessential wonderful business.
Charlie Munger Strategy Gemini BUY BRK-B 16.26 $491.93
Berkshire Hathaway represents the pinnacle of the 'wonderful business' philosophy, acting as a diversified holding company of high-quality, cash-generative operating businesses and investments. Led by a proven capital allocation framework, it offers a defensive yet compounding investment with exposure to premier insurance, railroad, and utility assets. The current price relative to book value and future earnings power presents a fair entry point for a core, long-term holding.
